qas.question: How many subscribers had access to TCM upon it launch?
When TCM premiered, what was AMC called?
What sorts of films did American Movie Classics primarily show?
By what year was AMC showing commercials?
How many subscribers had access to AMC upon its launch?
When TCM ended, what was AMC called?
What sorts of films did TCM primarily show?
By what year was TCM showing commercials?
Who originally served as a free format to AMC?

context: At the time of its launch, <b8_0>TCM<b8_0/> was available to approximately <a0_0><b4_0>one million<b4_0/><a0_0/> cable television subscribers. The network originally served as a competitor to AMC – which at the time was known as "<a1_0><b5_0>American Movie Classics<b5_0/><a1_0/>" and maintained a virtually identical format to TCM, as both networks largely focused on films <a2_0><b6_0>released prior to 1970<b6_0/><a2_0/> and aired them in an uncut, uncolorized, and commercial-free format. AMC had broadened its film content to feature colorized and more recent films by <a3_0><b7_0>2002<b7_0/><a3_0/> and abandoned its commercial-free format, leaving TCM as the only movie-oriented cable channel to devote its programming entirely to classic films without commercial interruption.
